reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

description.narrative: Tasma Bioenergy (Tasma) has engaged into several feasibility studies and also commercial contracting phase with private companies to convert their fossil fuel -based energy generation to sustainable renewable bioenergy and therefore reducing CO2 emissions. The objectives:- Construction of a steam energy and power plants- Reduction of CO2 emissions- Reduction of industrial biomass waste (suppliers)- Developing systematic processes (ESMS HR policies code of conduct etc.) in order to enable and facilitate coor dinated controlled and sustainable processes of the businessAs next steps Tasma will:A) Company development? Development and implementation of Environmental and Social Action Plan i. Assessment ii. Development of ESMS Policy Manual Procedures and Implement ationiii. Pollution prevention and Mitigationiv. Community health safety and securityv. Biodiversity and Natural Resources ManagementExternal consultant / expert will be contracted to facilitate the process? Finalising equity and debt financing for the pil ot plant and preferably for part of the project pipeline? Recruiting key personnel in order to conduct feasibility study in Southeast Asia predominantly Vietnam and Philippines.? Developing sustainability criteria and tools for evaluation of environmental and social risks related to biomass supply to the plant; current suppliers are evaluated on case-by-case basis rather than according to systematic approach.B) Build a pilot plant? Finalising the steam purchase contract with the client? Converting term-shee ts on biomass supply into proper supply contracts? Final EPC supplier selection and contract? Recruitment of operating personnel for the plantC) Develop further project pipeline to maximise the CO2 emission reductions and developed social and environmental best practice? Finalising ongoing feasibility studies for 5 units? Re-initiating partner identification and selection and seek for further clients. Tasma has been preoccupied with existing clients has not been able to explore new biomass supply partners c ustomer groups segments or regions. This also requires more resources and calls for expansion of the organization.
